answers.answer: Well, with a c section, you dont need to worry about the shoulders being wide. You would only worry about that if you were having a vaginal birth. As far as the breastfeeding goes, if your concerned about that i wouldnt be put asleep. They typically dont knock you out unless its medically necessary. Ive had 2 c sections and having a 3rd so although nerve racking, the epidural isnt that bad. It makes me more nervous but thats it. I would much rather be awake so i can see and hear my baby when she is born.
Gd babies are not always bigger. I have it and im 32+4 and my baby is normal sized. Have you had any growth scans? Also if you follow the diet they give you for it will help slow down growth.
